data.title: Enable regex's ^, $ and ^$ to be matched in file dialog
data.body: Fixes #278

data.title: Find does not match multi-line regex strings
data.body:
The Find dialog (Ctrl+F) does not allow multi-line finds using the `\n` character as it currently considers each line individually. See [`TextModel._doFindMatches`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/editor/common/model/textModel.ts)

_Created out of a discussion in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/278_

data.title: Find and replace with regex on does not allow replacing with \n
data.body:
The same applies to `\r` and `\t`, not sure if there are any others.

**Repro**
1. Open a file
2. Ctrl+H to bring up find and replace
3. Turn on regular expression matching
4. Match a word
5. Put `\n` in the replace text box
6. Press Replace All

**Expected**

The matched words are replaced with new lines

**Actual**

The matched words are replaces with `\n`

data.title: Allow to create multiple files at once from the command line with glob patterns

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I would like to have a feature to create multiple file at once.

For example if you type the following pattern as a filename for a new file:

```
test.{css,ts,html}, test2.{css,ts,html}
```

It should create the following files:
- test.css
- test.ts
- test.html
- test2.css
- test2.ts
- test2.html

This would save a lot time.

Is this something I can do with an extension or must I edit the electron-browser to get it running?

I think an extension would be the better way because it is something special and not directly obvious to the user. What do you think? Of cause we can discuss the format for this operation. The example above is just a first try.

I would implement it and do a pull request (if I must change vscode directly).

data.body: Code does translate correctly the tilde ~ as a proper path reference when the code runs (but that may be mono or core-clr doing that magic, or roslyn), but when I cmd-click the link, Code offers to create a new folder in the path that literally includes the tilde as the folder name in that path, when it should convert it to the proper path of wwwroot...this is in the _Layout.cshtml file. I'm unsure where to look in the code so I can see what it's doing to offer a fix.

data.title: High DPI scaling for UI or settings for UI addition
data.body:
I'm testing this on a MacBook Pro 2015 Retina screen with Windows 10 stable build in Bootcamp.
VS Code here does not scale according to my Windows DPI scaling settings, which is set to 125%.

As it does not, editor UI looks super tiny as the MBP has `2880px X 1800px` resolution.
I'm attaching a screenshot:

![visual studio code high dpi](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7989797/11289953/791322c8-8f3a-11e5-83b0-cbd99a5300e3.png)

In User Settings I can change editor font size, but not UI:

```
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings
{
    "editor.fontSize": 18
}
```
#122 might be related, but it talks about DPI scaling issues with blurriness, which is not the case for me. The UI is just super tiny.

milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Awesome idea however that just work for simple signature. for example interface like

``` typescript

interface IDoSometing {
  getData(url: string, fn: (error, result) => void)
}

```

will generate this

``` typescript

var x: IDoSometing;
x.getData(url, fn, error, result)

```

and also please add an option to pick from overloads.

data.title: For large git repositories the git integration button shows a visually distracting clock periodically

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
`git status` takes around 2 seconds to run on my large repository, the blue clock icon on git integration to indicate "working" can be quite visually distracting as it seems to ping the repo every 5-10 seconds.

![git](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/11287544/4a6665ac-8ed1-11e5-8b46-31fb323a658e.png)

I'm not so sure there is a benefit in indicating work unless the user explicitly requested it, such as when clicking the button.

data.title: Add 'turn' to <angle> and 'dppx' to <resolution> data types for CSS auto-complete
data.body: Fixes #293

data.title: Missing <angle> and <resolution> units in CSS auto-complete
data.body:
- turn missing from <angle> http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-values/#angles
- dppx missing from <resolution> http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-values/#resolution-value

data.title: Unable to specify a search sub-folder
data.body:
Surprisingly, there is no way to specify a search folder location. VS Code forces me to use the base folder for all my searches (and the base folder contains a lot of files). 

Sublime Text allows me to specify a sub-folder to reduce the scope of the search. 

This, combined with the other issue #63 makes it impossible for me to switch from Sublime Text to Code.

data.title: persisting zoom in/zoom out settings
data.body: The magnification settings (Ctrl+/Ctrl-) reset to the default between sessions, and they also reset to default when opening a new folder. It would be great if these settings were stickier, as they are in many other editors - would eliminate some clumsiness when using Code in presentations, for example.

data.title: Update css <length> units used by CSS auto-complete
data.body:
Fixes #289.

I’ve not added the 'q' unit as it isn’t supported by any browser. I’m not sure what VSCode’s policy is about that.

data.title: Missing length units in CSS autocomplete
data.body:
- ch unit 
- q unit (this is not supported anywhere yet)
- viewport relative units

data.title: Add php reserved keyword "yield"
data.body: http://php.net/manual/en/reserved.keywords.php

data.title: Editor no longer closes quotes for PHP
data.body: After last update, editor no longer closes quotes (double|single) on PHP files. Does close quotes on settings file. Can't find setting to control as such. Brackets work fine.

data.title: [json] Can't find/use tmLanguage scope "source.json"
data.body:
I've installed the Asciidoc extension (https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items/justusadam.language-asciidoc) but can't get syntax highlighting on [source,json] blocks.

Analysing the ".tmLanguage" file I've tested switching "source.json" with "source.js" and it worked as expected (for javascript), however the syntax is not the one expected for json (like in .md files):

Before change:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/840518/11285175/54ae1a9a-8ef5-11e5-8d46-126b9013d297.png)

After change:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/840518/11285250/ade9174a-8ef5-11e5-8228-4251f29c5096.png)

Expected:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/840518/11285326/1419e8aa-8ef6-11e5-8ea7-b917bd50b170.png)

I've also looked for "source.json" scopeName in all files of this repository (Branch: master) but couldn't find it.

Thanks in advance for your attention. =)

data.title: Debugging without an open folder
data.body:
Why is folder required to have debugging enabled? 
Case in point - trying out single file ps scripts. Am I missing something?
